pageTitle: Prime Minister’s itinerary for Thursday, December 5, 2019 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Note: All times local

Ottawa, Ontario

9:00 a.m. The Prime Minister will attend the election of the Speaker of the House of  Commons.

1:30 p.m. The Prime Minister will meet with the Premier of the Northwest Territories, the Honourable Caroline Cochrane.

Office of the Prime Minister
West Block
Parliament Hill

Notes for media:

  • Photo opportunity at the beginning of the meeting
  • Media are asked to gather in the third floor foyer no later than 1:00 p.m.

2:30 p.m. The Prime Minister will participate in the Speech from the Throne procession and ceremony to officially open the first session of the 43rd Parliament.

Senate of Canada
2 Rideau Street

Notes for media:

  • Pooled coverage
  • Media attendance is for accredited members of the Canadian Parliamentary Press Gallery only. For more information, contact Philippe Perrier at 613-992-6517 or philippe.perrier@parl.gc.ca.
  • The Speech from the Throne will be broadcast live on television and online at https://senparlvu.parl.gc.ca/Harmony
  • A livestream of the Speech from the Throne will be shared on social media on the following social media channels:
    • Twitter (@CanadianPM / @PMcanadien)
    • Facebook (Canadian Democracy / La démocratie canadienne)
    • YouTube (Prime Minister of Canada / Premier ministre du Canada)
